definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: I always wanted to do the killing part. 'Is that a dagger that I see before me?
sentences.chinese: 我一直想扮演刺客，我面前看到的是柄短剑吗？

sentences.english: Kennedy was shot from a warehouse and his assassin ran and hid in a theater.
sentences.chinese: 刺客躲在仓库里暗杀甘迺迪后逃走躲进一间戏院里。

sentences.english: Ben Mattes of Ubisoft shows an upcoming version of Assassin's Creed.
sentences.chinese: 本育碧马茨显示了刺客的信条即将推出的版本。

sentences.english: I never aspired to be an assassin.
Captured international assassins are locked up inside a high-tech bunker known as the Killing Chamber.
sentences.chinese: 占领国际刺客被锁在高科技掩体称为杀戮室。

sentences.english: Assassins seldom hang around after they finish an assignment.
sentences.chinese: 刺客完成任务后，几乎不会滞留在案发地。

sentences.english: You have found the man and gotten vengeance for the dead monks.
sentences.chinese: 你找到了那个刺客并为那些死去的修道士们报了仇。

sentences.english: Days to pay two drums, taking advantage of revelry left Aheng assassin, ran to the sun and the moon Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 天交二鼓，刺客趁酒兴离开了阿衡，向日月阁奔去。

sentences.english: No one knows that this is the candidate’s intended assassin.
sentences.chinese: 没有人知道这个人就是试图取帕默性命的刺客。

sentences.english: With a strangled cry, the assassin dropped from the tree and hit the ground. He began to run.
sentences.chinese: 刺客忽然大叫一声，从树上跳到地上，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: A relic said to be worn by a famous dual wielding assassin.
sentences.chinese: 据说是一个著名双持刺客以前使用过遗物。

sentences.english: Her novel, The Blind Assassin, won the 2000 Booker Prize.
sentences.chinese: 她的小说《盲刺客》荣获了2000年的布克奖。

sentences.english: The main character is an assassin who is hired to kill the president of France.
sentences.chinese: 主角是个刺客，要去刺杀法国总统。

sentences.english: Roy:To the room of a dwarven assassin who happens to like taller women.
sentences.chinese: 去那个正巧喜欢高个子女人的矮人刺客的房间。

sentences.english: and they turned out to be assassins?
sentences.chinese: 如果他们回家之后成为刺客了呢？

definition: one who has mastered the sutras (Buddhism)
to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
Bai Qi (-258 BC), famous general of Qin 秦國|秦国, the victor at 長平|长平 in 260 BC/same as 公孫起|公孙起
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
person willing to sacrifice his life (for a good cause)
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
berserker (Norse warrior or fantasy role-playing character)
